This late 15th-century 'Seven Sacraments' font has eight carved panels around the outside of the bowl depicting: 1. Baptism (the baby is being dipped warily into the font. The mother, wearing wired head-dress, has the chrism robe over her right arm
column2: 2. Marriage, the bridegroom holds his turban cap in his right hand
column5: 5. Eucharist, with the rite shown at the elevation of the Host
column6: the server holds the sacring bell in his hand
column7: 6. Penance, with horned and winged fiend expelled, the confession of a female penitent
column8: 7. Extreme Unction (see Image 309). In the eighth panel is an image of the Baptism of Christ. The figures on the octagonal shaft of the font include archangels, the four doctors of the church bearing scrolls, and St Edmund, the favourite East Anglian saint and martyr.
